paper_abstract: Let Phi (u x w nu, k, lambda(a), lambda(c)) denote the largest possible size among all 2-D (u x nu, k, lambda(a), lambda(c))-OOCs. In this paper, the exact value of Phi (u x v, k, lambda(a), k - 1) for lambda(a) = k - 1 and k is determined. The case lambda(a) = k - 1 is a generalization of a result in Yang (Inform Process Lett 40:85-87, 1991) which deals with one dimensional OOCs namely, u = 1.
paper_title: Two classes of optimal two-dimensional OOCs
